frw.common.delete.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete {{param}}?
frw.common.deleteRule.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the rule?

frw.addChainDialog.title: Add chain
frw.addChainDialog.name: Name
frw.addChainDialog.errorNameMustStartWithCharacters: Name must start with one of the characters A-Z, a-z, _
frw.addChainDialog.errorNameMayContainCharacters: Name may contain the characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _

frw.configStartPage.storeHint: Note that all changes are applied immediately. To apply the changes persistently, click the 'Save firewall configuration' button.
frw.configStartPage.inputFilter.title: Input filter
frw.configStartPage.inputFilter.description: Filter incoming packets that address this device
frw.configStartPage.forwardFilter.title: Forward filter
frw.configStartPage.forwardFilter.description: Filter incoming packets that address other targets and pass this device
frw.configStartPage.outputFilter.title: Output filter
frw.configStartPage.outputFilter.description: Filter outgoing packets created by this device
frw.configStartPage.destinationNat.title: Destination NAT
frw.configStartPage.sourceNat.title: Source NAT

frw.chainList.name: Name
frw.chainList.deleteChain.title: Delete chain
frw.chainList.addItemInfoTextInput: Filter incoming network packets that address this device
frw.chainList.addItemInfoTextOutput: Filter outgoing network packets created by this device
frw.chainList.addItemInfoTextForward: Filter incoming network packets that address other targets and are routed through this device
frw.chainList.addItemInfoTextPrerouting: Destination NAT replaces the destination address of network packets with the address of the actual recipient.
frw.chainList.addItemInfoTextPostrouting: Source NAT replaces the source address of network packets with the address of this device.

frw.chainPage.name: Name
frw.chainPage.acceptHint: If you are creating a chain with default policy "Accept", your rules should reject or drop matching packets.
frw.chainPage.dropHint: If you are creating a chain with default policy "Drop", your rules should accept matching packets.
frw.chainPage.stdChainHint1: This chain has automatically been generated from standard firewall data.
frw.chainPage.stdChainHint2: Its properties cannot be changed here, and you cannot add, remove, or modify any rules.
frw.chainPage.reorderRulesHint: To reorder rules, drag & drop the corresponding rows
frw.chainPage.errorNameMustStartWithCharacters: Name must start with one of the characters A-Z, a-z, _
frw.chainPage.errorNameMayContainCharacters: Name may contain the characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _
frw.chainPage.deleteRule.title: Delete rule
frw.chainPage.selectDropPolicy.title: Select 'Drop' default policy
frw.chainPage.refuseSelectDropPolicyMsg: This chain currently does not contain any rule with an 'Accept' action. By switching the default policy to 'Drop', the system would no longer be reachable. The default policy will not be changed.
frw.chainPage.selectDropPolicy.confirmation: Are you sure you want to select 'Drop' as default policy? If the rules are not configured properly the system might no longer be reachable afterwards

frw.ruleEditorDialog.title: Rule
frw.ruleEditorDialog.name: Name
frw.ruleEditorDialog.reorderExpressionsHint: To reorder expressions, drag & drop the corresponding rows
frw.ruleEditorDialog.errorNameMayContainCharacters: Name may contain the characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _ and spaces between them
frw.ruleEditorDialog.minExpressionWarning: A rule must contain at least one expression.
frw.ruleEditorDialog.errorCommentMayNotContainCharacters: Comment may not contain the following characters: '\[]{}'

frw.canLeaveAppGuard.title: Unsaved changes on firewall configuration
frw.canLeaveAppGuard.description: You made changes to the firewall configuration. You can save your changes, discard your changes or cancel to continue editing.

frw.notification.errorMissingPermissions: You do not have the required permissions.

frw.startPage.storeHint: Note that all changes are applied immediately. To apply the changes persistently, click the 'Save firewall configuration persistently' button.

frw.filterRules.filterRulesInfoText1: Filter rules control the data traffic by allowing or blocking data packets based on criteria such as direction, protocol, IP addresses and port numbers.
frw.filterRules.filterRulesInfoText2: They work at the transition point from internal to external networks and serve to protect internal networks from external threats.
frw.filterRules.filterRulesInfoText3: By selecting 'Drop' as the default action, all data packets that do not match the criteria of one of the existing filter rules are discarded.
frw.filterRules.defaultAction: Default action for non-matching data packets
frw.filterRules.deleteFilterRule.title: Delete filter rule
frw.filterRules.selectDropDefaultAction.title: Select 'Drop' default action
frw.filterRules.refuseSelectDropDefaultActionMsg: Currently no filter rule is configured with an 'Accept' action. Changing the default action to 'Drop' would make the system unreachable. Therefore the default action will not be changed.
frw.filterRules.selectDropDefaultAction.confirmation: Are you sure you want to select 'Drop' as default action? If the filter rules are not configured properly the system might be unreachable afterwards.

frw.filterRuleEditor.inputExplanation: Matches packages that address this device. The packages destination address equals the ip address of this device.
frw.filterRuleEditor.outputExplanation: Matches packages that originate from this device. The packages source address equals the ip address of this device.
frw.filterRuleEditor.forwardExplanation: Matches packages that are routed through this device
frw.filterRuleEditor.descriptionInvalidCharacters: Description must not contain the following characters: '\[]{}'
frw.filterRuleEditor.addressMustNotStartWithSpace: Address must not start with a space
frw.filterRuleEditor.addressMustNotEndWithSpace: Address must not end with a space
frw.filterRuleEditor.invalidAddressSpecMsg_ipv4: Enter a valid IPv4 address, address range or subnet
frw.filterRuleEditor.invalidAddressSpecMsg_ipv6: Enter a valid IPv6 address, address range or subnet
frw.filterRuleEditor.portMustNotStartWithSpace: Port must not start with a space
frw.filterRuleEditor.portMustNotEndWithSpace: Port must not end with a space
frw.filterRuleEditor.invalidPortSpecMsg: Enter a valid port, port range or port list

frw.routingRules.routingRulesInfoText1: Routing rules control IP address and port translation between networks. They operate at packet level and can be categorized into three types:
frw.routingRules.routingRulesInfoText2: Source NAT replaces the source IP address (and optionally the source port) of outgoing packets with the address and port specified in the rule.
frw.routingRules.routingRulesInfoText3: Masquerading replaces the source IP address with the current IP address of the outgoing interface, while the optional port specification remains available.
frw.routingRules.routingRulesInfoText4: Destination NAT replaces the destination IP address (and optionally the destination port) of incoming packets with the address and port specified in the rule.
frw.routingRules.deleteRoutingRule.title: Delete routing rule

frw.routingRuleEditor.sourceNatExplanation: Replaces the source IP address and optionally the source port of outgoing packets with the address and port specified
frw.routingRuleEditor.masqueradeExplanation: Replaces the source IP address with the current IP address of the outgoing interface
frw.routingRuleEditor.destinationNatExplanation: Replaces the destination IP address and optionally the destination port of incoming packets with the address and port specified
frw.routingRuleEditor.descriptionInvalidCharacters: Description must not contain the following characters: '\[]{}'
frw.routingRuleEditor.addressMustNotStartWithSpace: Address must not start with a space
frw.routingRuleEditor.addressMustNotEndWithSpace: Address must not end with a space
frw.routingRuleEditor.invalidAddressSpecMsg_ipv4: Enter a valid IPv4 address, address range or subnet
frw.routingRuleEditor.invalidAddressSpecMsg_ipv6: Enter a valid IPv6 address, address range or subnet
frw.routingRuleEditor.portMustNotStartWithSpace: Port must not start with a space
frw.routingRuleEditor.portMustNotEndWithSpace: Port must not end with a space
frw.routingRuleEditor.invalidPortSpecMsg: Enter a valid port, port range or port list

frw.interfaceRules.interfaceRulesInfoText1: Interface rules define how incoming and outgoing traffic is handled at interface level.
frw.interfaceRules.interfaceRulesInfoText2: They provide a simple way of reducing the attack surface without the need for complex rule creation.
frw.interfaceRules.deleteInterfaceRule.title: Delete interface rule

frw.interfaceRuleEditor.preventLockoutHint: Activate this option on interfaces used for web-based configuration
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.dropAllExceptEstRelHint: Allows established connections, blocks new traffic without informing clients
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.rejectAllExceptEstRelHint: Allows established connections, blocks new traffic and informs clients
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.acceptAllHint: Allows established connections as well as new traffic
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.rejectHint: Blocks all traffic and informs clients
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.dropHint: Blocks all traffic without informing clients
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.descriptionInvalidCharacters: Description must not contain the following characters: '\[]{}'
frw.interfaceRuleEditor.lockoutWarning.tooltip: Please select this option with caution to avoid locking yourself out.
